We also include all vehicle safaris, cruises, guided walks, park entrance fees and spotlighting fees where mentioned on the itinerary. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around (including around 7 hours of spotlighting per night when in Deramakot) and extra-long night safaris in Tabin - these have been specifically negotiated; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the Bornean forests. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide).

Seasons:

We recommend this tour is run at the end of the dry season, which in North East Borneo is August – September. However Borneo is notorious for rain and we expect rain throughout the year. Local climates are affected by the presence of mountain ranges throughout Malaysia, and climate can be divided into that of the highlands, the lowlands, and coastal regions. The coasts have a sunny climate, with temperatures ranging between 23-32°C (73.4-89.6°F), and rainfall ranging from 10-30cm (4-12in) a month. The lowlands have a similar temperature, but follow a more distinctive rainfall pattern and show very high humidity levels. The highlands are cooler and wetter, and display a greater temperature variation. A large amount of cloud cover is present over the highlands, which have humidity levels that do not fall below 75%.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced naturalist as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• We can also offer further wildlife watching activities if they present themselves whilst on the trip. For example our local guides keep their ears to the ground and have many contacts and if and when a new location of animal is known and reliably seen we can head there to experience it.
• We will stay in a variety of accommodation when on this tour, from well established wildlife eco lodges to guest houses and chalets deep inside privately run forest reserves.
• We will split our focus and activity depending on where we are and what we are looking for. For example in Deramakot, Tabin and Kinabatangan we will be spotlighting in the night. But we will also be focusing on daytime species in Tabin and Kinabatangan too, no other tour will offer as much time spent looking for wildlife in Borneo than this one.
• We have specially negotiated extra-long night safaris in Tabin to further increase our chances of seeing nocturnal and rare species.
• All the above reasons give this, our specialist tour for Borneo’s rarest wildlife including clouded leopards and other elusive mammal species a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here. We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout Borneo so that we can try and find and observe animals such as the Sunda clouded leopard, Sunda leopard cat, flat-headed cat, marbled cat and bay cat and many more species. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of Borneo at other times of year and focusing on other species such as otter civets and Hose’s civet and many other rare mammals of Borneo. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour visits 3 main areas in the province of Sabah in the north-eastern part of Malaysian Borneo. We will arrive into the town of Lahad Datu and fly out of Sandakan. In between we will visit Deramakot Forest Reserve, the Sakau region of the Kinabatangan River and also the Tabin Wildlife Reserve.

Fitness Level:

The majority of the wildlife activities will be done in a vehicle or boat and so there is no great level of physical fitness needed.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 18 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Sandakan / Deramakot Forest Reserve - Today you will be collect from the airport (or your hotel if you have arrived in Sandakan prior to the start of the tour) in Sandakan and start our drive towards Deramakot Forest Reserve. This 55,000 hectare reserve is home to many of Borneo’s large and iconic species including elephants, orangutans, Borneo gibbon, banteng and several elusive species which are seen here with more regularity than anywhere else in the world. It is these species which are the real highlight for us and our main targets when here. They are also largely nocturnal and so we will head out into the forest at night for extended drives. This is to maximise our chances of seeing the wonderful Sunda clouded leopard, sun bear and marbled cat, but along with these species several other rare species have been seen here such as Sunda colugo, Sunda pangolin, banded linsang among other incredible and rare species.

Kinabatangan River - This morning we will leave Deramakot after breakfast and then depart towards the village of Sakau along the banks of the Kinabatangan River. On our arrival we will check in and then have lunch. Afterwards we will be taken on the river for our first river cruise / safari. The longest river in Sabah, Kinabatangan River measures 560 km from its headwaters in the Crocker Range of southwest Sabah to its outlet at the Sulu Sea on the East coast of Sabah and according to the World Wildlife Fund (WWF), the Kinabatangan wildlife sanctuary is one of only two known places on Earth where 10 primate species can be found living wild. The enigmatic Bornean orangutan and the curious looking proboscis monkeys are the two most sought after primate species here however the ubiquitous long-tailed (or crab-eating) macaque is the most common. Other than the primates mammals are well represented here however most species are nocturnal or very elusive. The largest inhabitants are Borneo’s own endemic sub-species of Asiatic elephant (the Borneo pygmy elephant) which we will try to see and the incredibly rare and nearly mythical Sumatran rhino. Another fairly common and large inhabitant here is the largest reptile in the world, the saltwater crocodile. This part of the river traces through lowland forest and mangrove swamps near the coast provide sanctuary for them. With all these diversity going around, it is no wonder Kinabatangan wildlife sanctuary is the best destination to get close-up and discover its remarkable wildlife and fascinating habitats. Bird watchers usually find the Kinabatangan simply incredible while they spot incredible bird species from the famous Borneo's hornbills to the rare Storms storks. After our first trip this afternoon we will return to the camp for dinner and then after dark head out again in search of semi aquatic flat-headed cat. There are some tributaries and sections of the main river in which it may be possible to see flat-headed cats. We will have a spotlight and search the river banks, here we will probably see the glowing eyes of the crocodiles as they watch from the riverbanks and hopefully spot flat-headed cats and other elusive species such as otter civets. We will return to the camp for the night after a hopefully successful search.

Kinabatangan River - Today is a full day to explore the forest and river around the lodge further and of course after dark we will head out on our second and final specific search for the flat-headed cat.

Gomatong Cave / Tabin Wildlife Sanctuary - This morning we will depart after breakfast from the Kinabatangan River and travel to Gomantong Cave, this is one of the world’s most famous caves and was immortalised in the BBC’s Planet Earth series due to the enormous mountain of guano and the millions of cockroaches and other invertebrates that live there. The forests around the caves are home to many species of wildlife including orangutans, in fact wild orangutans can possibly be seen throughout the entire trip we are taking, so it is always worth keeping an eye out for them in all of the forests. The cave is some 90m high and full of wildlife, alongside the innumerable invertebrates including the odd looking long-legged centipedes there are four species of swiftlet (white-nest, black-nest, mossy-nest and white-bellied) and around 27 species of bats (mostly wrinkle-lipped bats which number around 2 million in the cave). The black-nest swiftlets are the species whose nests are collected and eaten as a delicacy in China and South East Asia. The nest harvests are done sustainably now and the method for collecting them involves the locals having to climb high up into the caves on a network of rickety ladders and ropes. The nearly self-sufficient ecosystem inside the cave is completed with predators including bat hawks and pythons that feed on the bats and swiftlets as they come and go from the caves. You will then continue on towards Tabin Wildlife Sanctuary. Once we get to the sanctuary we will check in, have lunch (depending on the time of everyone’s flights) and head out into the forest (the exact itinerary of our daytime activities is variable and may change but we will have a morning and afternoon excursion into the forest on each full day here); Today we may start with a guide walk with one of their expert local guides. Nestled within the rainforest beside the Lipad river, the resort is home to a surprising variety of birds, insects and small mammals, even right beside the buildings of the resort it is possible to see several species and discover the rich variety of jungle herbs, some endemic, used for generations by local folks for the treatment of various ailments. In the afternoon we are likely to visit the active Lipad mud volcano which provides a mineral salt lick for wildlife. After trekking through the rainforest for around 20 minutes, we arrive at the elevated bare area of the mud volcano which is frequented by wildlife (elephants, bearded pigs, sambar, muntjacs and other species) and birds. The adventurous among us can try the effects of the volcanic mud, said to be responsible for a fine complexion, by applying the mud to their skin. Trek back to the resort along elephant trail, which is a great way to experience the forest and spot elusive species that live in the dense forests here. We will have one pre dawn drive included over this couple of days as well. After dinner we will have our first extended night drive and try and find some of the nocturnal mammals which are abundant here. With luck it is possible for Sunda clouded leopards, flat-headed cats and sun bears here but it is more likely that we will find various flying squirrels, several species of civets, yellow-throated martens, Philippine slow loris as well as reptiles and amphibians.
Home - This morning we will have breakfast and then be taken to the airport in Sandakan to catch your return flight home.

generalInfo:
Sepilok - Kinabatangan - Sukau - Tabin National Park - Kota Kinabalu Beach

This Borneo adventure encompasses the highlights of Sabah state, with a family focus. Think lots of wildlife, jungle sights, mud volcanoes and beachy vibes. There truly is something for everyone in your family to enjoy.

The adventure begins in the small town of Sepilok. Home to Sepilok Orangutan Rehabilitation centre, Sun bear conservation centre, and rainforest discovery centre, this really is the beating heart of animal welfare in Northern Borneo. Get up close and personal with these magnificent great apes, before checking out the smallest specie of bear on the planet.

The wildlife spotting has only just begun. Your next stop is Borneo's longest river, Kinabatangan. From wild monkeys to toucans and pygmy elephants, cloud leopards and crocs there are very few places on earth that you can see such a wealth of wild animals in a concentrated area.

After your journey down the river, it is time to head deeper into the rainforest in Tabin National Park. Your expert local guide knows the landscape like the back of their hand and there is no better way to see the lizards, birds, bats and larger mammals that populate this biodiverse region.

After all that adventure, it's time for a well earned break. Spend some quality family time in our luxurious resort near Kota Kinabalu. Grab a bite to eat and watch as the golden sun sets across the turquoise horizon. Perfect!

This itinerary has been put together based on the school summer holidays. With some superb jungle activities, it is recommended for children from eight years and up. However, as this trip is tailor made, we are able to amend trips to accommodate a range of ages and times of year. Give us a call to chat with one of our friendly Borneo travel specialists today. They have specialised in family travel for many years, and have taken their own children to far flung destinations, so know how important it is to get this right!

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Sepilok: After your flight, your family is sure to want to take it easy. You’ll be spending a couple of days at our in style resort in the jungle at Sepilok. This is the starting point for your trip to see the orangutans. You can acclimatise, or if you’re feeling active you can walk through the rolling hills and gardens and check out the flora and fauna. The kids are sure to be entranced by the sounds and sights of the surrounding jungle.

Rivers, Jungles & Orangutans: Take the kids into Borneo’s wilderness. You’ll visit the world famous Sepilok Orangutan Rehabilitation Center where you’ll come face to face with these great apes – a moment your family will never forget. Together with a local guide you’ll leave the mainland and sail deeper into the jungle on Borneo’s longest river, Kinabatangan. Nowhere in Borneo can you see as many wild animals together than here. From monkeys to crocodiles, tropical birds to elephants and sun bears to lizards; keep your camera handy at every moment! You’ll sleep in a jungle lodge located deep in the forest between the lush nature of Borneo.

Wildlife & Waterfalls: Today, you’ll head to Lahad Datu, the starting point of Tabin National Park. You’ll be collected from your hotel by your driver for this shared transfer. It’ll take about 2 hours, and we find this to be the most comfortable way when travelling with your family. You’ll head deep into the wilderness with your family and travel into the heart of the jungle where you’ll be staying in a wooden bungalow. All your food and tours are included whilst here, and the restaurant has a great choice of foods for the whole family. Over the next couple of days, you’ll set out by jeep and on foot to see monkeys, bats, monitor lizards and tropical birds in a rainbow of colours, amongst a variety of other creatures. Your local guide will take you to a nearby mud volcano, and if you’re lucky you might even catch a glimpse of an elephant or an orangutan, so keep your eyes peeled. On the third morning, you’ll head back to Lahad Datu.

Borneo Beach Break: After your Tabin adventure, you’ll head back to Kota Kinabalu by flight where you’ll then be transferred to our beach resort. The next few days are all about quality family time at the beach where you’ll spend 3 nights kicking back, doing as much or as little as you like. You’ll stay in an In Style resort on the outskirts of Kota Kinabalu where the beach goes on for miles, the calm sea offers a refreshing dip and the whole family is catered for with plenty of restaurants and activities. At the end of your stay, we’ll transfer you back to the airport for your onward flight, to begin your journey home.

generalInfo:
This unforgettable Borneo Honeymoon offers you a tempting mix of boutique resorts, rustic lodges, adventure, wildlife and relaxation. You will see Orangutans, Proboscis Monkeys, Pygmy Elephants (if you're lucky) and wildlife galore. This is the perfect experience for those wanting an extra-special honeymoon away from the crowds to make memories to last a lifetime.

As a tailor-made travel specialist we can offer you a complete hand-made approach to your plans and wishes for this special holiday. We offer everything from 3* city options to 5* properties plus boutique and eco island stays. Please ask should you wish for this itinerary to be further tailored to your needs and explore the alternative options available.

During your honeymoon, you will visit the renowned Sepilok Rehabilitation Centre. This leading conservation centre houses orphaned Orangutans and helps to return them to the wild. You will also visit the Sun Bear Conservation Centre close by.

Set out on a river cruise to explore the heart of Borneo’s rainforest. Enjoy meandering along the river spotting wildlife, disembark to trek into the jungle and enjoy overnight stays while the sounds of the jungle resonate around you.

At the end of your incredible jungle journey, retire to the sanctuary of an idyllic island to savour luxurious accommodation by the beach, romantic meals for two and some well-deserved rest, relaxation and romance. Room types have been upgraded where possible to give you added luxury and we can tailor this honeymoon to your exact requirements and budget.

dayInfo.description: Depart the UK on an overnight flight to Kuala Lumpur. We'd be happy to give you a quote for flights.

Arrive into Kuala Lumpur and transfer to your hotel. A garden city with plenty to see and do. The frenetic Chinatown, the splendid Moorish architecture of the Sultan Abdul Samad Building and railway station; the Petronas Twin Towers, the Lake Garden with its Butterfly Farm, Batu Caves, Orchid Garden…and much more.
Fly to Borneo - you will be met by our wonderful ground agents who will transfer you to your luxurious lodge on the edge of the jungle where you can relax for the afternoon. (D)

Day at your leisure to explore Sepilok. We’ll include a complimentary tour of the facilities in the morning! Sepilok Sanctuary covers 4,000 hectares and is one of only four Orangutan sanctuaries in the world. Start with watching the feeding session at the Orangutan Sanctuary. You can also visit the Bornean Sun Bear Conservation Centre which houses over 30 Sun Bears while the Rainforest Discovery Centre has a 147m canopy walkway , offering an unrivalled experience to traverse the treetops 28m above the forest floor. (B,L,D)

Transfer to Abai to your riverside lodge. Surrounded by lush greenery, this is the wildlife epicentre of Borneo and best place to find wild orangutan. After a relaxing lunch, take a cruise downriver on the hunt for Proboscis Monkeys and the Hornbill as well as Pygmy Elephants and Orangutans. (B, L, D)
Transfer further upriver to Sukau and enjoy another day of wildlife observation. (B, L, D)

Transfer overland to the Danum Valley. Danum is one of the few places in Borneo where you can stay in luxury within a primary rainforest, at the amaing Borneo Rainforest Lodge. Search for the Clouded Leopard, an Orangutan or Proboscis Monkey. After lunch, enjoy a trek through in one of the world's oldest remaining rainforests and enjoying a thrilling suspension walkway through the treetops. In the evening, a night time jeep tour takes you out spotting nocturnal animals. (B, L, D)

A full day to explore Danum Valley starting with a nature walk, a trek to a stunning viewpoint for a bird-eye view over the rainforest and Danum Valley, and a trip to a bubbling spring for a refreshing dip. After dinner, join a night walk around the lodge to spot wildlife. (B, L, D)

Transfer back to Kota Kinabalu and on to your luxurious beach escape, the perfect way to end your honeymoon in Borneo. Surrounded by pristine beaches, you can relax, swim, snorkel and indulge in delicious food and spa experiences. Learn about the conservation efforts of this eco-resort and assist with coral planting (optional) (B)
Enjoy complete relaxation at your island resort. (B)
Day at leisure until check out for your boat transfer back to Kota Kinabalu and onto the airport for your return flight back to the UK (B)

generalInfo:
Secluded jungle, lush interior mountains, enchanting wildlife and intriguing tribal history. Kalimantan offers a side to Borneo that fewer people experience and we’re taking you out onto its rivers. The fearsome headhunting traditions and mysterious jungle creatures of this region, intrigued past explorers and are still enticing adventurous travellers to this exotic corner of the globe. The conservation efforts of the Borneo Orangutan Survival Foundation and the chance to see their rescued and rehabilitated orangutans is an emotionally uplifting yet sobering experience and one that cannot be missed. And, just as moving, is spotting these awe-inspiring creatures in the wild.

We start our journey in Tumbang Malahoi, where we are welcomed into the home of a Dayak Ngaju tribe. Moving into the forest, we look out for hornbills and wild orangutans whilst marvelling at the endemic vegetation of the region. Departing on our river cruise, we see the forest from a different perspective as we float by small villages before canoeing through the glittering black water lake and keeping our eyes peeled as we search for proboscis monkeys and Brahminy kites. Heading upstream along the Rungan River, we leave our beautifully crafted river boat for our motorised canoes which transport us to the orangutan pre-release islands managed by the Borneo Orangutan Survival Foundation. We learn all about their vital work and spend some time watching the orangutans before cruising to the tiny riverside village of Kanarakan, where we are welcomed with a performance from the elders of the Dayak Ngaju tribe. We wander the rubber fields, village and gardens and share stories over a traditional spiced coffee or herbal tea. Lake Tahai is the perfect spot for canoeing and early morning bird watching, whilst Sei Gohong is the next village on our route, where our education of traditional practises in Kalimantan continues when we meet the local medicine expert.

Our last few days are packed full of activities as we visit Samboja Lestari, the site of the first BOSF orangutan introduction programme. Whether it be leisurely nature walks, a hike deep into the rainforest or a trip with a local fisherman that takes your fancy, there is plenty on offer for everyone. The real highlight at Samboja though, is our visit to the orangutan island, a natural, semi-wild home for orangutans that cannot be released and the sun bear sanctuary. Rugged and unruly, Kalimantan translates to ‘River of Diamonds’, so what better way to explore this tropical wonderland, than via the river.

dayInfo.description: Jakarta - Arrive in Jakarta and transfer to your hotel. Overnight FM7 Hotel or similar.

Palangkaraya – Tumbang Malahoi - Fly to Palangkaraya and then drive to Tumbang Malahoi, where we stay in a traditional Dayak longhouse. In the evening, we join the family of the longhouse for dinner and talk with the elders about everyday life here and their culture and traditions. Overnight simple longhouse. (BD)

Tumbang Malahoi - Accompanied by a local guide we hike in the surrounding forest, learning about local agriculture and how rubber is tapped from the trees. In the afternoon, we visit a Kaharingan (the Dayak traditional religion) temple and then in the evening see traditional Dayak dances. Overnight simple longhouse. (BLD)
Palangkaraya - Drive back to Palangkaraya. Afternoon at leisure. Overnight Swiss Belhotel. (B)

Palangkaraya - Travelling across the black Sebangau Lake and Sebangau River by speedboat, we reach the start point of our trek. The trek takes us into the peat swamp forest of Sebangau National Park to see endemic vegetation and to spot wildlife such as hornbills, wild orangutans and monitor lizards. Overnight Swiss Belhotel. (BL)

Palangkaraya - We depart from Palangkaraya for our river cruise. We pass stilt and floating houses and continue along the forested river, passing various villages. In the evening, we canoe through the shimmering black water lake and make a stop for a short stroll around Kalaweit island, keeping an eye out for proboscis monkeys, hornbills and Brahminy kites. We return to our cruise boat in the evening for a quiet dinner in the midst of the forest. Overnight Rahai’i Pangun cruise boat. (BLD)

Bapallas Island - Kanarakan – Tahai - Continue upstream along the Rungan River. At Bapallas Island, we travel by boat to observe orangutans on the pre-release islands of the Borneo Orangutan Survival Foundation. We then cruise to Kanarakan and explore the village, home gardens and rubber fields, as well as visiting a local home. Returning to our boat we continue to Lake Tahai. Overnight Rahai’i Pangun cruise boat. (BLD)

Tahai – Sei Gohong – Bapallas and Muara Rungan - Optional early morning birdwatching, then visit the village of Sei Gohong where we will meet an expert in traditional medicine and walk to the nearby forest to find several plants that are used as traditional medications by the Ngaju people. We board the boat and cruise downstream to Muara Rungan passing Bapallas Island to spot more orangutans. Overnight Rahai’i Pangun cruise boat. (BLD)

Palangkaraya - We cruise to the village of Tanjung Sanggalang on the Kahayan River and then drive to Bukit Rawi and Sigi, where we will see ancient Dayak painted sandungs and watch a traditional dance. We cruise to Palangkaraya in the afternoon and spend the rest of the day at leisure. Overnight Swiss Belhotel. (BL)
Balikpapan – Samboja - Fly to Balikpapan and transfer to Samboja Lodge, situated on the Samboja Lestari Reforestation Estate. Overnight Samboja Lodge. (BD)

Samboja - There are two daily activities at Samboja that we can join. The first is a visit to one of the six man-made Orangutan Islands that are a short walk from the lodge. The island that can be visited, is home to orangutans that cannot be released into the wild due to handicaps and behavioural issues. There is a two-metre wide canal around the island from which we can view the orangutan from a safe distance, ensuring their well-being is protected. We may see the workers bringing over all kinds of fruits, vegetables and leafy branches and our guide will explain all about the project. The second is a visit to the Sun bear sanctuary and there is a bridge over the enclosure from which we can observe the Sun bears’ behaviour. Overnight Samboja Lodge (BLD)

Samboja - We have a full day to explore the Samboja area and there are optional excursions available. You could opt for a 2-hour nature walk to try and spot a variety of wildlife including blood pythons, red leaf monkeys and a variety of birds, or you may want to go on a more challenging hike in the protected forest area of Sungai Wain in hope of spotting female orangutans and their babies. Alternatively, you could choose to go on a boat ride with local fishermen along the Sungai Hitam or ‘black river’ to search for highly endangered proboscis monkeys. Overnight Samboja Lodge. (BLD)
Jakarta - Fly to Jakarta and spend the rest of the day at leisure. FM7 Hotel or similar. (B)
Jakarta - Transfer to the airport for your onward or homebound flight. (B)

tourName: Kuala Lumpur and Sabah wildlife tour
placesVisited: Kuala Lumpur, Sandakan, Borneo, Abai Jungle Lodge, Jungle river cruise, Abai village visit, Borneo Rainforest Lodge, Danum Valley, Canopy walkway, Kota Kinabalu, Potential wildlife sightings include: orangutans, crocodiles, proboscis monkeys and hundreds of bird species
generalInfo:
Taking in Kuala Lumpur and the highlights of Sabah, this itinerary provides an in-depth wildlife experience coupled with an introduction to the renowned food and heritage of Malaysia.

Accommodation is a mixture of simple yet characterful lodges and comfortable city hotels. Begin with two nights in Kuala Lumpur where you will visit the landmark Petronas Towers and uncover the city's heritage buildings.

Then it's off to Borneo where you will have one night in Sepilok before spending two nights at a riverside lodge on the Kinabatangan River. Here you will have the opportunity to spot wild orangutan and pygmy elephants before delving further inland to Borneo's pristine primary rainforest.

Finish with time in Kota Kinabalu, home to stunning sunsets and excellent food.

dayInfo.description: Today you begin your journey by boarding your international outbound flight to Kuala Lumpur.

On arrival in Kuala Lumpur you will be greeted by a local representative and taken to your hotel - the journey takes approximately one hour so there will be plenty of time to learn more about the city from your guide. Check in to your central hotel and have the rest of the day at leisure. Your view will be of the Petronas Towers - the best known landmark in KL.

After breakfast you will head over to the towers to take a closer look. Access the skybridge and viewpoint giving you panoramic views over the city. Later you will enjoy a privately guided tour taking in many of Kuala Lumpur's heritage sights before returning to your hotel. Why not enjoy a sundowner at the Traders Sky Bar - which has one of the best views in the city.

An early start today as you have breakfast before transferring to the airport. Today you fly to Sandakan in neighbouring Borneo. On arrival you will be met by a local guide and taken to your accommodation. After settling in you will have time to try out the resort's inviting pool or relax on your beautiful balcony - your window to the rainforest. This evening you will enjoy a simple dinner in the main restaurant followed by the opportunity to spot resident flying fox soaring from tree to tree. Later, as darkness falls there is an optional guided night walk through the adjacent forest. The walk is fairly easy going and gives the chance of seeing insects or if lucky, nocturnal wildlife.

After breakfast you will transfer to Sim Sim jetty where you will meet your shared boat to Abai Jungle Lodge. En-route you will have your first chance to spot some of the river's abundant wildlife. Upon reaching the lodge you will check in and enjoy lunch before embarking on an afternoon river cruise. Your local guide and spotter will search out the best locations to find animals such as Orangutan, Crocodile, Monkey and birdlife. Watch the sun set over the Kinabatangan before viewing fireflies at their most active. Return to the lodge for dinner. After dinner you will have the opportunity to join a guided night walk to the rear of the lodge.

Rise early to witness the river coming to life followed by a trip to the nearby Ox Bow Lake. Here you will see a different side to the area and have time to enjoy a morning cup of tea before heading back to the lodge for breakfast. Early this afternoon you will cross over to Abai village where you will enjoy a short tour followed by tree planting. Lunch is served back at the lodge before embarking on a final trip up river towards the Menanggol tributary. Here you are sure to see Proboscis Monkeys in close proximity as well as a selection of birdlife.

After breakfast you will leave Abai behind and travel to Sukau in time to meet your road transfer to Lahad Datu. After registering at the lodge headquarters in Lahad Datu you will set off on the bumpy three hour transfer to Borneo Rainforest Lodge. On arrival you will be welcomed by the staff and meet your private nature guide who will look after you for the duration of the your stay. As an introduction to the Danum Valley today you will head to the canopy walkway this afternoon and take a night safari this evening.

Today you have the opportunity to explore the jungle by foot on one of the lodge's many trails. There are further details in your itinerary but you are best to discuss the options with your guide for a more detailed overview and indeed the current trail conditions based on the weather at the time. Later in the day you can walk up the river bank with your inner tube and float back down the river taking in the jungle from a different perspective. Tonight you may like to head out on the night safari but there is also the opportunity to do a night walk with your guide.

You will retrace your steps back to Lahad Datu today in time for your afternoon flight to Kota Kinabalu. On arrival you will be met by a local guide and taken to your city hotel. This evening is free to relax or explore at your own leisure. It is recommended you view the sunset from the hotel's pool side bar or perhaps head down to the waterfront area for an evening meal.

This morning you will join a renowned chef for a guided tour around a local farmers' market before trying your hand at preparing a few staple dishes. Afterwards you will sit down to enjoy the freshly prepared indigenous feast.
Today you will bid farewell to Kota Kinabalu and continue with your onward arrangements. Your return flight will arrive the same day.

tourName: Kutai National Park orangutan holiday, Borneo
generalInfo:
Our 8-Day Kutai NP and Samboja Orangutan Experience will guide you through the wonders of East Kalimantan, beginning with Kutai National Park. This unique destination is home not only to orangutans but also to the rare proboscis monkey and the false gavial crocodile. During your time in the park, you will stay in simple accommodations used by researchers and rangers. Nights will be spent on deck on comfortable mattresses with mosquito nets, equipped with basic amenities. Our dedicated team will prepare delicious meals for breakfast, lunch, and dinner throughout your stay.


Kutai National Park in East Kalimantan beckons with its rare and fascinating wildlife. However, it is the orangutan, our close relative, that draws most visitors. Their captivating beauty and gentle nature are truly enchanting. This expedition will allow you to observe both wild and rehabilitated orangutans, offering intimate encounters with these incredible creatures in their natural surroundings. If you seek adventure with a purpose, this is the expedition for you.

East Kalimantan's Kutai National Park boasts remarkable biodiversity. Its landscape transitions from coastal mangrove swamps and lowland rainforests to gentle inland hills and alluvial plains, marking the beginning of the deep jungle. Towering dipterocarpus, valuable ebony, and ironwood trees are scattered throughout. The exotic wildlife includes the iconic orangutan, found only on Sumatra and Borneo, alongside a rich array of other forest inhabitants and bird species. Kalimantan's dense jungles and expansive wetlands have historically isolated the region, making it a destination for intrepid travelers. Here, you can immerse yourself in the vibrant traditional culture and witness a stunning variety of exotic flora and fauna through captivating jungle explorations and unforgettable wildlife encounters.Samboja Lestari: A Haven of Restoration

HIGHLIGHTS

- Trekking Kutai National Park rainforest in search of wild orangutans
- Visit Samboja Lodge to see rehabilitation projects for orangutan and sun bears.
- Travel up jungle rivers to view proboscis, ebony and grey macaque monkeys
- Part of your expedition cost is directly donated to help save orangutans and rainforests

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Bali or Jakarta. Upon arrival, you will be met and transferred to your hotel for an overnight stay.

Bali/Jakarta to Balikpapan and Mangrove Tour. This morning, you will take a flight to Balikpapan. After lunch at a local restaurant, you'll arrive in Kampong Baru and board a speedboat. Cruise across the bay for a chance to see freshwater dolphins and proboscis monkeys. Following the bay cruise, you will be transferred to your hotel for the night. (B,L)

Travel to Sangata from Balikpapan Today involves a scenic 6-7 hour drive to Sangata. En route, we will stop for a vegetarian lunch at a Buddhist Monastery and at the Equator monument. You will arrive in Sangata in the late afternoon and check into your hotel. A briefing about your jungle adventure tomorrow will follow. (B,L)

Jungle Trek in Camp Kutai National Park. An early start begins with a 20-minute motorised canoe trip upriver to the National Park Rangers station. After meeting your rangers and guide, embark on a jungle trek with a forestry ranger to search for wildlife, particularly orangutans. Enjoy the forest canopy and have lunch in the camp. Another forest walk in the afternoon (around 3:00 pm) offers more opportunities for wildlife and orangutan sightings, including the possibility of seeing them build their nests for the night. Return to camp for dinner, followed by an optional short night trek to look for tarantulas and other nocturnal creatures. Overnight in the camp with provided mattresses and mosquito nets. (B,L,D)

Camp Kutai National Park to Samboja Eco Lodge via Sangata. After an early 6:00 am wake-up, breakfast, and check-out, you will once again travel down the Sangata River by motorised canoe. Upon arrival, a 6-7 hour car transfer will take you to Samboja Eco Lodge. Check-in upon arrival for your accommodation. Lunch will be at a local restaurant, with dinner and overnight at the Eco Lodge.

Orangutan and Sun Bear Sanctuary, Black River Exploration. Following breakfast, the morning starts with observing the orangutans during their feeding time, followed by a visit to the Sun Bears. From the office tower, enjoy panoramic views of the surroundings. Return to the Ecolodge for lunch and some relaxation. In the late afternoon (5:00 pm), a 30-minute drive will take you to the Black River. Board a motorised canoe on the Black River to observe the endemic proboscis monkeys in their mangrove habitat. Return to Samboja Eco Lodge in the late afternoon for dinner and overnight. (B,L,D)

Samboja Eco Lodge to Balikpapan Airport and onward to Jakarta or Bali. After breakfast and check-out, you will be transferred to Balikpapan airport for your flight to Jakarta or Bali. Overnight stay at FM7 hotel in Jakarta or Holiday Inn Express in Bali. (B)
TOUR ENDS Departure from Jakarta or Bali. This morning, you will be transferred to the airport for your return flight home. (B)

tourName: Luxury beach holiday in Borneo & Orangutans
placesVisited: Kuching, The Ranee hotel, day in Bako National Park with private guide, Semenggoh Wildlife Centre, private culinary tour of Kuching, fly to Kota Kinabalu, speedboat ride to Gaya Island, Gaya Island Resort, private beach, snorkelling, spa
generalInfo:
This 13 day luxury beach holiday in Borneo includes the chance to see orangutans, too. You’ll spend four nights in Kuching, the capital of Sarawak, and then transfer to Gaya Island Resort for a further seven nights.

Kuching is a great city to wander, sitting on the banks of the Sarawak River, where Chinese temples, churches, colonial buildings and the handsome Istana Palace rub shoulders. While here, you can enjoy a private culinary tour of the city, visiting the spice market and tasting lots of local food. You will also have a visit to Semenggoh Wildlife Centre, which is one of the only places in Sarawak where you can see orangutans, and a day in Bako National Park with a private guide. The park is easily reached from Kuching by boat, and here its rivers, jungle and mangroves can be explored on foot or by boat. Keep an eye out for the birds and wildlife that live here – your guide will help you spot everything – including the unusual looking proboscis monkey. Your base while in Kuching is the Ranee, a beautiful boutique hotel in the centre of the Old Town.

Next, transfer to Pulau Gaya, the biggest of five islands in the Tunku Abdul Rahman Park. You’ll be staying at the Gaya Island Resort, which overlooks a white sand beach and is surrounded by rainforest – in fact, some of the buildings sit on stilts so they’re amongst the forest canopy. Mount Kinabalu is visible in the distance and just offshore there are coral reefs, making this a paradise for divers and snorkelers. The resort even has its own private beach, which you can reach via a short speedboat ride.

dayInfo.description: Fly to Kuching
On arrival in Kuching, you will be transferred by private vehicle to your hotel. Settle in and explore some of the busy markets and Chinese temples
Spend a full day exploring beautiful Bako National Park with your private guide. The lush rainforest is home to abundant wildlife including proboscis monkeys, found only in Borneo, and macaques
Today you will visit Semenggok Orangu-tan sanctuary to learn more about these fascinating animals. Perhaps one of the closest relatives to humans, orang-utans are found only in Borneo and Indonesia.

This morning you will enjoy a private culinary tour of Kuching, sampling local dishes and visiting the spice market. In the afternoon, transfer to the airport for your flight to Kota Kinabalu. You will be met at the airport and drive to Sutera Harbour for the speedboat ride over to Gaya Island.
Relax and settle into this beautiful resort or enjoy the daily nature walk. You might like to take a trip to the resort's private beach at Tavajun Bay and see the turtle sanctuary there.
Spend some time snorkelling on the house reef or enjoy a pampering treatment at the beautiful spa. Tonight why not take a sunset cruise or arrange for a private dinner overlooking the ocean.
Days at Leisure
A speedboat will take you back to the harbour, in order to meet your transfer back to the airport.
Arrival back home

generalInfo:
Kuala Lumpur - Ipoh - Penang - Kota Kinabalu - Sepilok - Kinabatangan - Sukau - Sandakan - Lankayan

This epic itinerary traverses the cosmopolitan cities and culinary delights of Malaysia before venturing deep into the jungle on an immersive, wildlife filled tour of Borneo.

Begin your trip in the bustling capital city of Malaysia, Kuala Lumpur, where modern meets traditional in a seamless cosmopolitan cityscape of epic proportions. Witness one of the most iconic skylines in the world before scaling the heights of the KL towers for a birds eye panorama of the city below. Immerse in the local streets from a different perspective as the city comes alive at night by enjoying lively food markets filled with different cuisines from the Malay, Chinese and Indian residents.

Next stop Ipoh, where your boutique & bohemian hotel reflects the colonial history and architecture of the locality. Enjoy a city tour complete with snacks and expert local guide.

Next up is Penang, famous for culinary delights, and a highlight for many travellers. This city cooks up a storm that is a perfect and flavoursome blend of Asian cuisines. Take a leisurely bike ride around Georgetown, a hub of Chinese, Indian and Malay cultures.

On to country number 2, beautiful Borneo. Enter the gateway to Sabah state, Kota Kinabalu. Named after Mount Kinabalu, your time here includes a visit to the lush and biodiverse Kinabalu national park where you can take a wander through the flora and fauna via canopy walk and jungle trail before kicking back to relax in Poring Hot Springs.

Just a short flight away lies the small town of Sepilok, the unsuspecting beating heart of animal conservation in Sabah state. Here you will visit world renowned Sepilok Orangutan Rehabilitation Centre and Endangered sun bear sanctuary. Following this, take to the Kinabatangan river in a traditional boat to witness more incredible creatures in their wild habitat. The inhabitants range from crocodiles to pygmy elephants, and there's no knowing what incredible experience lies just around the corner.

After a busy few days of city hopping and wildlife spotting, its time to catch a vibe in the sunshine on picturesque Lankayan island, the perfect spot to watch baby turtles be released into the turquoise sea, and the sun set over the horison.

What are you waiting for? Get in touch with one of our friendly Borneo specialists today to secure your adventure.

dayInfo.description: Twin Towers & Chopsticks: Kuala Lumpur is a city of exciting extremes, where space-age skyscrapers nudge up against cluttered Chinese markets and timeless Indian restaurants. You’ll explore Kuala Lumpur independently, watching east bump into west with your own eyes. You can stare up at the famous Petronas Towers, throw yourself into lively food-court culture and get a bird’s eye view from the top of the KL Tower.

Colonial Sights and Culinary Delights: Next you’ll take the train to the colonial city of Ipoh, which usually takes around 2 and a half hours. Today you will arrive in Ipoh – one of the largest cities in Malaysia with plenty of colonial charm. You’ll stay in a boutique hotel in the old town, perfect for exploring this fascinating city on foot. During your time here we’ll organise a city tour with an English speaking guide who’ll be able to tell you all about the city’s history. Ipoh is one of the culinary centres of Malaysia, and you’ll sample some typical Malaysian snacks whilst here.

Bites and Bikes of Penang: After breakfast it’s time to bid farewell to Ipoh. Your driver will pick you up from your hotel for your 2 hour journey to Penang. Penang is a patchwork of Chinese, Indian and Malay cultures, there’s something fascinating happening on every street corner. The food here is famous throughout the world, a mouth-watering hotchpotch of Asian flavours that will get your taste buds dancing. During this trip you’ll take a bike ride around Georgetown, the cultural heart of Penang and sample some tasty traditional cuisine.

Kota Kinabalu Gateway to Sabah: Next, you’ll be transferred to the airport, which takes around 45 minutes, for your flight to Kota Kinabalu, Borneo. The direct flight time is around 2 and a half hours. This bustling coastal city at the foot of the immense Mount Kinabalu is the starting point for your journey through Sabah. On arrival, you’ll be transferred to your central hotel close to the restaurants and colourful markets of the city. Kota Kinabalu is a relatively modern city with many western influences and a whole host of delicious local food to try. The next day you’ll head to Kinabalu National Park with a guide to discover the wildlife and plants which call this place home, getting a different perspective as you explore from the canopy walks high above the forest floor.

Orangutans and a Jungle Boat Cruise: Next, you’ll be collected from your hotel by our driver and transferred to the airport for your flight over to Sandakan. The direct flight takes about 45 minutes. Borneo is the land of orangutans, and the very best place to see them and learn all about them is at the Sepilok Orangutan Rehabilitation Centre. This morning you’ll join a small group and will travel to Sepilok, where a guide will answer any questions you may have about the park’s hairy inhabitants. At feeding time you’ll find yourself at a safe distance, yet incredibly close to the endearing primates. You’ll also stop in at a Sunbear Sanctuary nearby, where you can see these unique, endangered bears. After your visit to Sepilok you’ll climb into a boat and you’ll travel deeper into the jungle, where you’ll spend 2 nights in a wooden lodge on the riverbank. No other spot in Borneo features such a wide variety of wild animals: monkeys, monitor lizards, crocodiles, sunbears, hundreds of species of tropical birds, and if you’re lucky you may even see wild pygmy elephants! During your time here you’ll have the opportunity to go on morning and evening boat cruises, where a local guide will help you spot whichever amazing creatures happen to be about. You’ll sleep with the sounds of the jungle all around you, before heading back along the river to Sandakan, where you’ll arrive around lunchtime/early afternoon.

Lazing on Lankayan: Next you’ll head back to Sandakan for a night in our In Style hotel before hopping over to Lankayan the next day. The boat crossing takes around 90 minutes and will usually leave from Sandakan at 10am. Lankayan Island is a secluded paradise hidden away in the tropical Sulu Sea just north of Sandakan, and the perfect place to rest up after your travels through Borneo. You can spend your days relaxing on the white sandy beaches or swimming in the crystal clear sea. The view beneath the sea is perhaps even more beautiful than above the water. Our local project, Reef Guardian is based on the island and if you’re lucky you’ll be able to watch the volunteers release baby turtles into the sea for their first swim! You will be staying in a seafront bungalow, situated right on the beach. All your meals are included and are served at the restaurant, which boasts an amazingly beautiful open-air wooden terrace. After your dinner, you can sit on the terrace and watch the sun setting over the sea. On your last day on the island you will leave at 7am and head back to Sandakan. Once you have arrived back on the mainland you’ll catch a taxi to the airport in Sandakan for your flight home.

placesVisited: Jakarta, Kumai, Tanjung Puting National Park, Forest walks, River safaris, Camp Leakey Research Centre, Orangutan feeding sites, Bird watching, Evening river cruise
generalInfo:
In association with the Orangutan Foundation we will be visiting and photographing the wild life in the Tanjung Puting National Park, Borneo. This trip is aimed at anyone who would like to develop their photography skills using a mixture of tutorials and one-on-one advice. As well as over 4000 orangutans, this bio-diversity hotspot is home to 30 other mammal species, 260 types of birds and 17 different reptiles.

There are no roads in this national park so will explore everyday by boat and on foot. As we gently glide along gorgeous rivers we will get incredibly close views of a huge variety of wildlife including orangutans, proboscis monkeys, agile gibbons, crocodiles, hornbills, kingfishers and lots of other birds. We will also visit orangutan feeding stations which provide additional food for released orangutans and the famous Camp Leakey research centre.

People will stay at a comfortable and eco friendly rain forest lodge and the trip will be escorted by a local guide, photographer Ian Wood and Ashley Leiman (OBE), director of the orangutan foundation. Suitable for anyone with a digital camera and a love of nature. Above all else we want the trip to be fun!

The group is limited to 7 people and £350 per person is donated directly to The Orangutan Foundation to help them continue to protect this vital area of rain forest along with other projects in Borneo.

dayInfo.description: Depart London to fly to Jakarta
Arrive Jakarta, transfer to hotel for the night
Fly Jakarta to Pangkalan Bun (1 and a half hour flight) arriving at 8 am. Transfer by car to Kumai (30 minutes) to board our boat for first full day in the National park.
Stay at Rimba Lodge, daily journeys into park by river and on foot.

Morning boat back to Kumai, transfer by car to Pankalan Bun. Fly Pangkalan Bun to Jakarta (1 and a half hours) arriving Jakarta approx 5 pm. Onward travel of transfer to hotel for the night depending on your international flight timings.
Depart Jakarta to fly back to London
Arrive London

tourName: Sabah and Sarawak tailor made holiday
generalInfo:
This itinerary is designed for curious travellers who want to go beyond the usual highlights of Borneo. You’ll uncover the cultural heritage of Kuching, meet orangutans, and admire Borneo’s natural beauty, including jungle treks, and a river cruise on the Kinabatangtan.

Along the way, you’ll stay in comfortable accommodation and enjoy meaningful experiences that reveal the real Borneo – from traditional longhouses to rare wildlife encounters.

You’ll start in Kuching, where the city’s layered heritage sets the scene. From there, travel deep into the interior to meet the Iban people in their remote longhouses, learning about their traditions first-hand.

You’ll visit little-visited villages, walk jungle trails to hidden waterfalls, and explore riverbanks teeming with wildlife.

A highlight of the trip is the visit to the famous Sepilok Orangutan Rehabilitation Centre and the Bornean Sun Bear Conservation Centre. From there, you'll travel by boat to Abai Jungle Lodge on the Kinabatangan River, where you will spend two nights in a chalet accommodation.

Whether you’re watching wild orangutans, sampling Indigenous dishes, or joining a traditional dance, each experience is thoughtfully designed to bring you closer to Borneo’s wild, natural beauty.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Kuching - Arrive at Kuching Airport, where you’ll be met and transferred to your hotel. Spend the afternoon settling in and enjoying the laid-back charm of the riverfront. You’ll be staying for two nights at the Riverside Majestic Kuching (Astana Wing), in a Superior River View room.

Kuching Heritage Walk & Food Trail - Discover Kuching’s vibrant cultural heritage on a guided walking tour. Wander through historic temples, museums, colonial-era buildings, and lively markets, each with its own story to tell. Along the way, sample a mix of local delicacies on a food trail that celebrates Sarawak’s wonderfully diverse flavours.

Semenggoh Wildlife & Journey to Bengoh - Visit Semenggoh Wildlife Rehabilitation Centre to observe semi-wild orangutans in a protected natural environment. Then travel on to Bengoh Dam, where you’ll cross the lake by boat to reach a scenic hilltop homestay in Kampung Sting. You’ll spend two nights in a shared dormitory at the homestay in Bengoh.

Hiking to Kling & Susung Waterfalls - Set off early for a rewarding hike through forest and plantations, leading you to the beautiful Kling and Susung waterfalls. Take a refreshing swim, enjoy a picnic lunch surrounded by nature, then head back to your peaceful homestay.

Trek to Ukom Longhouse - Walk downhill through rural countryside and quiet villages towards Batang Ai Hydro Lake. From here, take a boat across the water to Ukom Longhouse, where you’ll be welcomed with traditional Iban hospitality. Enjoy a cultural performance in the evening and spend the night in a communal longhouse. You’ll stay in the dormitory-style guesthouse at Nanga Ukom Longhouse.

Longhouse Culture & Return to Kuching - After a fascinating blowpipe demonstration and cultural walk around the longhouse, you’ll return to Kuching. The evening is yours to unwind and enjoy at your own pace. You’ll spend the night at the Riverside Majestic Kuching, Astana Wing, in a Superior River View room.

Flight to Kota Kinabalu - You'll be transferred to the airport for your flight to Kota Kinabalu. On arrival, check in to your hotel and spend the rest of the day exploring or relaxing as you wish. You'll be staying for two nights at Le Meridien Kota Kinabalu in an Urban Room.

Mari-Mari Cultural Vllage - Explore Sabah’s rich cultural heritage at Mari-Mari Cultural Village. Try your hand at traditional skills, witness age-old rituals, and experience a lively performance that celebrates the region’s diverse ethnic traditions.

Kinabalu Park and Transfer to Sepilok - Take a scenic drive through the mountains to Kinabalu Park and Nabalu Market, stopping to enjoy the cool highland air and views along the way. From there, continue overland to Sandakan, where you’ll check in to MY Nature Resort. Settle into your Standard Chalet and unwind in the peaceful natural surroundings. You’ll stay here for one night.

Sepilok Orangutan Centre & Abai Jungle Lodge - Start your adventure with a visit to the renowned Sepilok Orangutan Rehabilitation Centre and the nearby Bornean Sun Bear Conservation Centre. From here, travel by boat along the Kinabatangan River to Abai Jungle Lodge. Evening and night cruises offer a magical chance to spot wildlife as the rainforest comes alive after dark. You’ll spend two nights at Abai Jungle Lodge in a Standard Chalet.

Pitas Oxbow Lake & Village Visit - Start your day with an early morning river cruise to Pitas Oxbow Lake, where you can enjoy excellent wildlife spotting. Afterwards, visit a local village and share a traditional lunch with the community. In the afternoon, embark on another river cruise for even more opportunities to see orangutans and other fascinating wildlife.

Return to Sandakan & Departure - Spend a leisurely morning at your own pace before a boat transfer takes you back to Sandakan. After lunch, you'll be transferred to the airport for your onward flight.

tourName: Sabah holiday, land beneath the wind
placesVisited: Kota Kinabalu, Dusun village, homestay, climb Mount Kinabalu, Poring Hot Springs, Kinabatangan River, wildlife cruises, night walks, Sandakan, Turtle Island, Sepilok Orangutan Rehabilitation Centre, optional: visit the Bornean Sun Bear Conservation Centre, War Memorial, final evening free in Kota Kinabalu
generalInfo:
Discover the fascinating wildlife and beautiful landscapes of Borneo on this Sabah holiday. Known as the Land Beneath the Wind, Sabah is a place of wild landscapes, hot springs, steamy jungles where orangutans live, and riverside villages.

This 11 day holiday introduces you to all Sabah’s highlights. Spend two days climbing Mount Kinabalu for amazing views, before unwinding in sulphurous hot springs. Visit an orangutan sanctuary and learn how these enigmatic creatures are being protected and watch sea turtles lay their eggs at night on the beaches of Turtle Island. You will also have a cruise on the Kinabatangan River, looking out for the unique wildlife that lives in the surrounding forests and meet the Dusun people, learning about their lives with a fun overnight homestay.

dayInfo.title: Kota Kinabalu.
dayInfo.description: Selamat datang! Welcome to Borneo, Malaysia. Your adventure begins in Kota Kinabalu with a welcome meeting at 6 pm. If you arrive early, maybe immerse yourself in the history of the city at the Sabah State Museum. You can also visit the Mari Mari Cultural Village or explore the islands off Kota Kinabalu – excellent for swimming and snorkelling. Tonight, perhaps head out with your group for a welcome dinner – your leader will have the best recommendations for local food and drinks.

dayInfo.title: Dusun Village.
dayInfo.description: Travel by minivan to a Dusun village that sits in the shadow of Mt Kinabalu – the highest mountain between the Himalayas and New Guinea – and enjoy a welcome lunch in your homestay with your hosts before visiting a local vegetable farm. Learn about planting and harvesting seasonal produce and then take some of these fresh vegetables home for dinner – a proper farm-to-table experience. Tonight, enjoy a special village cultural performance.

dayInfo.title: Dusun Village.
dayInfo.description: Start your day by walking to the local vegetable market in Kundasang with your leader. Located in the heart of the community, this market showcases an array of freshly harvested produce, from locally grown vegetables to unique regional seasonal fruits like tarap and rambutan. You'll also find local snacks, wild honey and traditional Borneo crafts. Take the opportunity to chat with vendors to learn about the local produce and how it’s used in traditional Sabah cuisine. The afternoon is yours to enjoy at your leisure – perhaps visit Poring Hot Springs to relax in the open-air baths before heading back to your homestay.

dayInfo.title: Kinabalu National Park.
dayInfo.description: Eat a good breakfast this morning and say goodbye to your friends in the village as it’s time to drive to Timpohon Gate to begin your trek up Mt Kinabalu. It’s no small feat – prepare for an uphill trail made of steep steps that vary considerably in size – but along the way you can take in the remarkable variety of plant life, including about 1000 species of orchid and the carnivorous pitcher plant (yes, really). After covering 6 km (approximately 4 to 6 hours), spend the night at a hostel near Laban Rata, located at 3,272m (10,735 ft) above sea level. Rest up for the final ascent (very!) early tomorrow morning.

dayInfo.title: Kinabalu National Park.
dayInfo.description: Rise at around 2 am this morning to continue your trek – it’s tough, but the sunrise at the summit will be well worth it. At the top, take in the jungles of Borneo in one direction and the South China Sea in the other. After a well-deserved rest and plenty of pictures, return to Laban Rata for breakfast. Then, get started on the descent which can take between 3 - 6 hours. This evening, enjoy your overnight stay at a hostel within Kinabalu National Park.

dayInfo.title: Kinabatangan River.
dayInfo.description: Journey by private bus into the steamy rainforest to Bilit – a small village on the banks of the Kinabatangan River – and then take a short boat ride to the comfortable jungle lodge where you’ll spend the night. Located on the riverbanks, the lodge is a brilliant place to spot wildlife. For even better spotting, head out on a sunset boat ride and look out for macaques, orangutan, proboscis monkeys and pygmy elephants. End your day by searching for nocturnal wildlife like civets, owls and the rare slow loris on a night walk.

dayInfo.title: Kinabatangan River.
dayInfo.description: Embark on another boat safari early this morning – different species come out at different times, so keep your eyes peeled! After breakfast, join the in-house guide for an insightful journey into the historical Kinabatangan community, which thrived long before tourism developed in the area. Explore traditional practices and craftsmanship and actively engage in the crafting of traditional fish traps. This hands-on experience provides a profound understanding of the local culture and heritage, fostering a deeper appreciation for their sustainable way of life. Then, head back on the boat for another river excursion in the afternoon.

dayInfo.title: Sepilok.
dayInfo.description: Say goodbye to your jungle lodge after breakfast and hit the road in a private minivan to a guesthouse located near the Sepilok Orangutan Rehabilitation Centre. Established to help reintroduce these wonderful creatures back into the wild after a life of domestication or being orphaned, this sanctuary offers a unique opportunity to witness conservation in action. From the viewing platform, watch and photograph the orangutans as they swing into view onto the feeding platform. Observe young orangutans as they learn how to climb a specially constructed jungle gym in a new nursery. To see more of Borneo’s creatures, there’s the option to visit the Bornean Sun Bear Conservation Center. Here, rescued sun bears, many of whom have endured years of mistreatment, are given a second chance at life. Learn about the rehabilitation process and how they are reintroduced back into the wild. You can also opt to visit the Rainforest Discovery Centre, where you can roam the treetop walkways while you learn more about the flora and birdlife of Borneo.

dayInfo.title: Turtle Island.
dayInfo.description: This morning, transfer to Sandakan to leave your large bags at the hotel and walk with your overnight bag to a nearby jetty. Travel by speedboat, past small fishing villages and bamboo fish traps, to Turtle Island Marine Park. In the afternoon, there will be some time for swimming, snorkelling or lazing about on the beach. In the evening, you’ll join an expert local ranger and a select group of visitors to watch giant green turtles coming ashore to lay their eggs under the moonlight. Watch the rangers as they release protected hatchlings and guide them in their frantic dash to the ocean. This is a moving experience that will stay with you long after your trip is over!

dayInfo.title: Sandakan.
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, return to the mainland and walk back to your hotel. Today is free to explore Sandakan as you wish – perhaps you’ll call into Agnes Keith House, the restored home of an American writer best known for her accounts of life in Borneo during WW1. Or you could visit the Sandakan War Memorial, built on the site of a Japanese Prisoners of War camp. Learn about the tragic Sandakan Death Marches, when 2400 prisoners of war were forced to walk through the jungles of Borneo and only six survived. Another great option is St Michaels & All Angels Church, a rare stone building in Sabah that managed to avoid major damage in the war.

dayInfo.title: Sandakan.
dayInfo.description: Your adventure ends today after breakfast. Additional accommodation can be pre-booked if you wish to spend more time exploring Borneo - just speak to your booking agent ahead of time.

generalInfo: Journey through Sabah's majestic landscapes, from sacred villages and lush rainforests to wildlife-rich riverbanks, witnessing Borneo's breathtaking nature and cultural treasures. This immersive adventure combines authentic village experiences with thrilling wildlife encounters along the Kinabatangan River.

dayInfo.description: Kota Kinabalu, Malaysia: Smooth Landings & Hassle-Free Arrival Day Warm Welcome at the Airport After touching down, look for our welcoming representative holding a sign with your surname, ready to greet you with a smile. Effortless Airport Transfer Your hassle-free journey continues with a convenient transfer from the airport directly to your accommodation, ensuring a smooth arrival experience. Settle into Your Accommodation Take this chance to unwind and settle into your room so you’re refreshed and ready for the adventure ahead.

Kota Kinabalu, Malaysia: Kiulu Hidden Hillside Village Adventure Scenic Journey to Kiulu Village Depart Kota Kinabalu by 8:00 AM and embark on a picturesque 2-hour drive to the secluded hillside village of Kiulu, nestled on the slopes of Mount Kinabalu. Along the way, absorb breathtaking views and anticipate a day full of cultural discovery. Village Exploration & Cultural Immersion Upon arrival, you’ll be welcomed by your friendly English-speaking host. Begin your adventure with a guided stroll around this ancient settlement, home to villagers who have honored the Mountain God for centuries. Feel the depth of local traditions that have stood the test of time. Authentic Home Visit & Coffee Tasting Visit a villager’s house to indulge in authentic, simple delicacies—prepared just for you. Savor the full journey of Sabah coffee, from freshly-picked beans to an aromatic cup brewed in true local style. Pineapple Factory Experience Next, tour the village’s pineapple factory, a community-run setup providing vital opportunities for local employment. Witness the step-by-step process of pineapple production and see how traditional skills blend with modern initiative. Herbal Walk & Pineapple Farm Adventure In the late afternoon, set out with your host on a guided walk through lush pineapple farms and venture to the village borders in search of unique local herbs. Learn about their culinary and medicinal uses from your knowledgeable guide. Host Family Dinner Conclude your memorable day by sharing a delightful, hearty dinner with your host family—an experience filled with laughter, warmth, and unforgettable flavors.

Kinabalu Park, Malaysia: Village Life & Flavors, City Bound Morning Village School Visit After a hearty breakfast with your hosts, take a stroll to the village’s primary school. Discover daily student life in rural Sabah and join a fun session learning to play the “Gong,” a treasured traditional musical instrument. Buzzing Bee Farm Experience Next, stop by a local, family-run bee farm. Here, you’ll taste freshly-harvested honey and sample local snacks, all while observing the fascinating honey-making process and chatting with the beekeepers. Fond Farewells & City Journey With new memories in tow, say a heartfelt goodbye to your welcoming host family. Then, leave the peaceful countryside behind as you return to the lively cityscape of Kota Kinabalu.

Kinabalu - Sepilok: Seamless Transfer & Flight to Sandakan Morning Preparation & Check-Out Get ready for your next adventure as our friendly representative meets you in your hotel lobby. They'll assist with your check-out and ensure everything's in order for your journey. Pickup is usually scheduled about two hours before your flight departure. Seamless Airport Transfer Relax as you’re chauffeured to Kota Kinabalu Airport in comfort, with plenty of time to spare for a stress-free check-in experience. Flight to Sandakan Take to the skies on a scenic flight from Kota Kinabalu to Sandakan—suggested flight AK 6496 departs at 13:55 and lands at 14:40. (Flight not included, estimated cost: $185, 20kg checked baggage allowance.) Warm Welcome in Sandakan On arrival in Sandakan, our friendly representative—look for your surname on their sign—welcomes you and ensures a hassle-free, private transfer to your next accommodation.

Sepilok: Sunset Safari & (Optional) Sanctuary Encounters Welcome to a Day of Discovery Your adventure begins early with a warm introduction before a scenic drive to Sepilok, surrounded by untouched Bornean rainforest. (Optional) Heartwarming Encounters at Sepilok 08:00 – 11:30 Opt to visit the renowned Sepilok Orangutan Rehabilitation Centre. Watch playful orangutans at feeding time from a forest platform and view a captivating 25-minute documentary about their journey to freedom. Bornean Sun Bear Sanctuary Continue to the Bornean Sun Bear Conservation Centre, where rescued Malayan sun bears are cared for and rehabilitated. Meet these fascinating creatures and learn about vital conservation efforts. Leisurely Countryside Walk Enjoy a peaceful 15-minute stroll through picturesque countryside to reach the sanctuaries, soaking in the natural surroundings. Lunch with Local Flavor Savor a delicious lunch at a local restaurant, sampling authentic regional dishes (included for those on the optional tour). Journey to Kinabatangan River Post-lunch, travel to the banks of the Kinabatangan River and transfer to the charming Borneo Natural Sukau Bilit Resort. Sunset Wildlife River Cruise 16:00 – 18:00 Set off on a mesmerizing sunset cruise along the Kinabatangan River. Keep your camera ready—spot proboscis monkeys, orangutans, macaques, elusive pygmy elephants, unique birds, and more. Wildlife sightings are likely but not guaranteed. Evening at the Resort Return to the resort for a relaxing evening and a hearty dinner surrounded by the sounds of the jungle.

Kinabatangan: Dawn-to-Dusk River and Jungle Adventure Sunrise Wildlife River Cruise Greet the dawn to the lively symphony of gibbons and hornbills as you glide down the river at sunrise. Observe the rainforest spring to life, spotting rare birds and elusive wildlife while the mist hovers over the water, creating an enchanting start to your day. Hearty Breakfast at the Resort Return to the comfort of your resort for a delicious breakfast, where flavors of the local cuisine will prepare you for the day’s adventures. Guided Jungle Trek Embark on a jungle trekking expedition with the resort’s expert guide. Wander through lush greenery, learning about fascinating plants and creatures unique to the area. Capture glimpses of dazzling birds or perhaps even a monkey swinging through the trees. Lunch at the Resort After your trek, relax and refuel with a freshly prepared lunch back at the resort, while sharing stories of your morning adventures. Sunset River Cruise Head back to the water for a magical cruise as the sun begins to set. The golden light illuminates the riverside, and the air is alive with birds and animals making their final appearance before night. Try to spot new species as you soak in the serene beauty. Dinner and Relaxation Return to the resort for a satisfying dinner and reflect on another unforgettable day immersed in nature.

Kinabatangan- Sandakan, Malaysia: Farewell to Kinabatangan Wildlife Sunrise River Adventure Wake just before dawn to embark on one last river cruise. Glide across the serene Kinabatangan River and witness the rainforest awakening—keep your eyes out for monkeys, hornbills, and maybe even wild orangutans in the mist-soaked trees. Final Breakfast at the Lodge Return to your riverside resort and gather for a hearty breakfast, sharing stories and memories of your jungle adventures as the rainforest bustles with morning life. Farewell and Departure Check out and bid farewell to the Kinabatangan. Board your shared transfer for a scenic drive back to Sandakan, carrying home unforgettable wildlife encounters. (Shared transfer available for flights departing after 2 pm.)

placesVisited: Sandakan, Kinabatangan River, Abai, Pitas Lake, Sepilok Nature Reserve, Sepilok Rehabilitation Centre, Kuching, Bako National Park, Batang Ai reservoir, spend time with local tribes people, Pulau Damai Beach
generalInfo:
This wonderful trip takes in the best of Borneo including both Sarawak and Sabah. You will begin your holiday in Sabah and a journey into the Kinabatangan region for a couple of nights. Here you may spot Proboscis Monkeys, Pygmy Elephants, the Hornbill and other numerous wildlife that frequents the river banks by day and night, you may even see a wild Orangutan! Don't worry if you don't as you will see them on your next stop at Sepilok where the Rehabilitation Centre holds twice daily feeding viewings. There is also the Sun Bear Rehabilitation Centre and the Rainforest Discovery Centre to explore.

On to the Sarawak region.
Bako National Park is a full day trip exploring one of the oldest national parks in Borneo and is one of the best places in Sarawak to see the wildlife in their natural surroundings. Tropical rainforest ranges from mangrove to kerangas, tropical swamp vegetation, cliff vegetation and beach vegetation. You will be hiking through jungle trails in search of the resident wildlife.

Next visit a traditional Longhouse. You will stay at a jungle lodge next to a longhouse and spend time with the local Iban people, learn about their culture, experience how they live and enjoy some local rice wine!

Spend your last few nights relaxing (or not) at a nature retreat, away from the bustle of Kuching.

Please ask us if you would like to include a stopover in Kuala Lumpur on the outward or return journey.

dayInfo.description: Depart UK on the overnight flight with Malaysia Airlines via Kuala Lumpur.
Arrive Sandakan and transfer to your hotel where the rest of your day is at leisure. (B)

Today you will be collected form your hotel and transferred to the jetty where you will take the boat cruise down the Kinabatangan River to Abai. After lunch, free time to relax before cruising upriver to search for the local wildlife. After dinner, a night cruise leads you to witness the beautiful fire flies glowing in the dark. Overnight in Abai. (B,L,D)

Take an early morning river cruise to Pitas Lake observing wildlife en-route. You may spot the Proboscis Monkeys, Pygmy Elephants and the numerous birdlife that live here. After breakfast, you have the opportunity to take part in the tree planting project followed by an optional lunch with the local Abai villagers. This afternoon you will have some free time before embarking on an afternoon river cruise. Overnight at the lodge (B,L,D)

This morning return to Sandakan by boat and visit the Central Market for a spot of souvenir shopping, the largest market in Sandakan with great sea views. After lunch, transfer to the Sepilok MY Nature Resort. You arrive in time for the afternoon feeding at Sepilok Orangutan Sanctuary. Night walk at the resort. Overnight Sepilok My Nature Resort (B,D,)

Day at leisure. You may wish to return to the Sepilok Rehabilitation Centre to see the Orangutans once again. There is also the Rainforest Discovery Centre to explore and learn about the flora and fauna which can be found in Borneo. Learn about the Sun Bears at the Conservation Centre where you can see the world's smallest bears which are also now under threat. (B)
This morning you fly to Kuching in the Sarawak region via Kota Kinabalu. On arrival, you will be met and transferred to your hotel in the centre of this accessible and delightful small city (B)

Day Trip to Bako National Park, one of the best places in Sarawak to see wildlife in their natural surroundings. Vegetation in the tropical rainforest ranges from mangrove to kerangas to tropical swamp. This popular tour gives you a brief taster of the wonders of Sarawak and introduces you to Long-Tail Macaques, monitor lizards and a wide variety of birds as well as the Proboscis Monkeys. Return to Kuching. [B,L]

Travel inland today to the Batang Ai reservoir passing pepper gardens, cocoa and rubber plantations to the jungles and rivers of Nanga Sumpa. Overnight will be spent in a jungle lodge close to a traditional Longhouse. Spend time with the locals and learn about their culture and sample some of the local rice wine! [B,L,D]

Explore Batang Ai. Full day exploring the surrounds and spending time with the local tribe people - learn how to fish on a river cruise. Overnight at Nanga Sumpa Lodge - a village stay operated by the locals of Ulu Ai [B/L/D]
Return to Kuching today and transfer to your nature resort to spend 3 nights relaxing at an intimate hideaway at the foot of Mount Santubong. (B)
Days at leisure to enjoy the facilities of the hotel, laze by the pool or embark on some of the excursions available from the hotel. (B)
Return to Kuching airport for your flight to Kota Kinabalu and onwards to London.
Arrive UK.

tourName: Sabah ultimate wildlife tour in Borneo
generalInfo:
Borneo is one of the world’s greatest wildlife watching destinations, a top 10 location for anyone with a vested interest in the natural world. Whether it is the incredible close relation to humans in the orangutan or the smaller than usual population of Asiatic elephants or even the wealth of birdlife, endemic reptiles and amphibians or the abundance of very rare mammals that hide by day and come out in the night; the island of Borneo is a treasure trove for any nature lover.

Introduction:
Asian wildlife doesn't come much more iconic that the massive red 'man of the forest', otherwise known as the orangutan or the second largest land animal in the world the Asiatic elephant and both of these incredible and endangered animals are easily seen in Borneo.

But there is much more to Bornean wildlife than these two species, there are hundreds of species of birds including no less then 15 species of large and stunning hornbills, many endemic species such as Proboscis monkeys and some real wildlife rarities like Sunda clouded leopards and sun bears.

As well as the birds and mammals which are most well known internationally the island of Borneo also has a wealth of reptile and amphibian life, from the large Saltwater crocodile and reticulated python to tiny flying frogs which glide through the forests and it is not just the animals, the plant life in Borneo is also second to none. Carnivorous pitcher plants lie in wait for unsuspecting insects and the world's largest flower the rafflesia is also found only in Borneo.

Some of these species are among the rarest in the world and with so much deforestation occurring throughout South East Asia there are fewer and fewer pockets of rainforest left each year.
